headline.main: F.T.C. Calls Rise In Smoking for '73 Steepest in Decade

docs.lead_paragraph: The Federal Trade Commission said today that it expected final figures on cigarette consumption for 1973 to show the largest yearly increase since the Surgeon General of the Public Health Service in 1963 warned of the effects smoking has upon health.
docs.snippet: The Federal Trade Commission said today that it expected final figures on cigarette consumption for 1973 to show the largest yearly increase since the Surgeon General of the Public Health Service in 1963 warned of the effects smoking has upon health.

headline.main: F. T. C. Calls Rise In Smoking for '73 Steepest in Decade

docs.abstract: FTC says that preliminary figures show that cigarette consumption rose 3.8% in '73, largest yrly increase since Surgeon Gen in '64 of adverse effect warned of smoking upon health; comm repeats recommendation that warning on cigarette packages be more specific about dangers to health; also recommends requiring warning on packages and ads for small cigars (S)

keywords.value: TOBACCO, TOBACCO PRODUCTS AND SMOKERS ARTICLES
